content.text: The database contains standard Formula 1 racing tables. There is no table related to social media followers. Let me confirm by checking the schemas of the most relevant tables.

content.content:
CREATE TABLE constructors
(
    constructorId  INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    constructorRef TEXT default '' not null,
    name           TEXT default '' not null
        unique,
    nationality    TEXT,
    url            TEXT default '' not null
);

tool_use_result.stdout:
CREATE TABLE constructors
(
    constructorId  INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    constructorRef TEXT default '' not null,
    name           TEXT default '' not null
        unique,
    nationality    TEXT,
    url            TEXT default '' not null
);

content.content:
CREATE TABLE constructorStandings
(
    constructorStandingsId INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    raceId                 INTEGER default 0 not null,
    constructorId          INTEGER default 0 not null,
    points                 REAL   default 0 not null,
    position               INTEGER,
    positionText           TEXT,
    wins                   INTEGER default 0 not null,
    foreign key (raceId) references races(raceId),
    foreign key (constructorId) references constructors(constructorId)
);

content.text:
The claim references "social media followers," which is a concept that does not exist anywhere in this database schema. The database contains only racing-related data (circuits, drivers, results, standings, lap times, pit stops, etc.) and has no social media information whatsoever.

This is a clear **OUT-OF-SCHEMA** case.
